testHelp

Class FractionAssertion

  • Object
    • GenericObjectAssertionBase<String,StringAssertion>
      • StringAssertion
        • FractionAssertion

  • public class FractionAssertion
extends StringAssertion
    Represents an assertion related to a Fraction. It should not be in the testHelp library as fractions are not part of the basic Java language, but I added it to make it simpler for students to write FractionalCalculator tests.
    Author:
    ejewart

      Constructors

      FractionAssertion(String subject, String... subjectDescArg)

      FractionAssertion isEquivalentTo(int n, int d, String... otherDescArg)
      Verifies that a fraction is equivalent to the specified fraction, expressed as integer numerator and denominators

    • Constructor Detail

      • FractionAssertion

        FractionAssertion(String subject,
                  String... subjectDescArg)
        construct a FractionAssertion object - will succeed only if the passed subject string can be converted to a Fraction object
        Parameters:
        subject - string representing a fraction in FractionalCalculator format
        subjectDescArg - an option description of the string/fraction

    • Method Detail

      • isEquivalentTo

        public FractionAssertion isEquivalentTo(String other,
                                        String... otherDescArg)
        Verifies that a fraction is equivalent to another fraction (they reduce to the same lowest terms)
        Parameters:
        other - a fraction in string form, must be numerator/denominator or whole_numerator/denominator
        otherDescArg - optional description of other fraction represented by string
        Returns:
        this if subject fraction is equivalent to other fraction
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if is equivalent to other fraction

      • isEquivalentTo

        public FractionAssertion isEquivalentTo(int n,
                                        int d,
                                        String... otherDescArg)
        Verifies that a fraction is equivalent to the specified fraction, expressed as integer numerator and denominators
        Parameters:
        n - numerator
        d - denominator
        otherDescArg - option description of other fraction representable as d / n
        Returns:
        this if subject fraction is equivalent to other fraction
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if is equivalent to other fraction
